headline: Super Easy Peanut Butter Cookies
description: These Kraft peanut butter cookies made with just 3 ingredients â€” smooth peanut butter, sugar, and egg â€” are great at Christmas and for gift-giving.
name: Super Easy Peanut Butter Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Mix together peanut butter, sugar, and egg in a large bowl until well blended.
Roll dough into 24 balls; place 4 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Flatten each ball with the back of a fork.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 20 minutes; do not overbake. Cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: done in 20 minutes and they taste amazing. they were crunchy on the outside and soft and tasty in the inside
It was quick and easy! The Grandkids loved them.

This recipe is wrong. Thereâ€™s too much sugar and theyâ€™re not baked long enough. Thereâ€™s only supposed to be 1/2 cup sugar and theyâ€™re supposed to bake at 325F for 12-15 min. I should have known better than to use a copycat recipe.

I have been making this recipe for literally decades now. And, I have progressed to a healthier version using natural peanut butter and monk fruit sweetener. They can be a bit harder and spread less, but still a fantastic cookie, kinda more like store bought consistency when you use the healthier ingredients. Also, I occasionally add a handful of caramel or Skor chips to the batch. Adds a kick of toffee flavour. AMAZING! As others have mentioned, ovens vary and also ingredient density varies as well. So, they may not be identical each time you make them, but thatâ€™s the nature of home baked goodies. I have never had a complaint with this recipe and my variations. My whole family devours them as fast as they are permitted! And, I love that I can whip a batch up so quickly and seem like a domestic goddess while exerting very little effort! ðŸ˜€
Literally the best cookies Iâ€™ve ver made
super tasty! im a first time baker. i heavily recommended to keep this in for 11 minutes, be generous with the peanut butter and sugar as it makes it moist, and make big cookies
Very fast& easy
I made this at 9:30pm because I was craving Kraft peanut butter cookies. They're super easy to make, don't take long to cook and they're yummy.
delicious and super simple! when i was rolling the balls i thought the dough wasnâ€™t firm enough but they turned out great! I also love adding chocolate chips to them and adding that sweetness!
These are the best peanut butter cookies.!
Excellent

I have always loved this recipie.. Only thing to keep in mind, try small batches at first... Each over cools diffeeent and these cookies as simple as recipie, they need a specific time for perfect texture (slightly soft and chew with crisp bottom.. Old over was 14 min..new over 17

Made the recipe exactly as stated, but doubled it. The cookie was delicious, but quite crumbly. I'm going to add another egg and some chocolate chips and see what happens with the second tray. Be right back with an update...second batch is in the oven. I noticed as the first tray has cooled, it is not so crumbly. I added an egg, 1 Tb water and 1/4 cup Lily's chocolate chips. The dough was amazingly like what I'm used to in a cookie with flour. Waiting...oh, yes!! This is more like it. Holds together well and the addition of a few chips is yummy. The additional ingredients make a different mouth feel, if that makes any sense. Still a tasty cookie (a bit 'oily' but I used an organic peanut butter with all its oil intact.), but I will make it again, next time using monkfruit/erythritol instead of sugar. I do believe different peanut butters may make a difference in the 'crumb' of a cookie. It's worth it when you make a new recipe that doesn't quite suit to tweak it a bit to see if it can be made more to your liking. Oh, and the results made a total of 54 cookies. Would have made the expected 60 but I tend to make them bigger as the work progresses for some odd reason.

This recipe is horrible. Yes, they tasted fine, but it was like eating SAND. They were so dry! The recipe calls for only 3 ingredients which, even I can't screw up, so I know it's not on me - it's on you, Kraft. Thumbs down.

This ha been my recipe for ten years, since I first read it off the peanut butter jar. Theyâ€™re super tasty and I highly recommend them. I like to add semisweet or dark chocolate chips. The bitterness really compliments the nutty flavour and they add gooey goodness. 
These definitely are burn-prone though so donâ€™t put them on the bottom rack; and keep a close eye on the browning edges!!!
The cookie dough was very oily and the bottoms were burned. Will not make again.

the cookie doh was REALLY oily and the 
 bottoms burnt in the oven 11 minutes in, other than that they tasted amazing

Easy recipe for my son he did good job they tasted excellent
Put them in the oven for 15 minutes, 20 would've been too much. I added a light sprinkle of salt before they went in the oven & a heaping 1/4 C peanut butter chips. The recipe made 15 yummy cookies.
I baked them for 8 minutes and they were too soft. Crumbled very easily. Next time I will add coconut flour.

I altered the recipe cause I find that to get 2 dozen you need to double the recipe, plus I added 1 cup of semi sweet chocolate chips to it , I think if had not added the chocolate chips I may have got 48 out of a single batch.
Not very good very quickly very dry I wonâ€™t make it again

it's the first thing I've made with all these recipes I've looked at with you I made them cuz they're easy and yes I added chopped walnuts and I made them only about an hour ago and I only have half of them left cuz I ate them and yes I will make them again thank you Allrecipes I am going to make the zucchini parmesan fritters tomorrow

Im a guy that burns stuff all the time. Just kidding i can cook. Just never been a good baker of sweets. I had very good luck on my first attempt. Good recipe. I just made big monster cookies instead of trying to get 24 of them, i got 6.

Made this at 9 pm. Had it finished and baking in 6 minutes. Easy to make. I had to substitute creamy peanut butter with crunchy, partly because I didn't have creamy and partly because creamy peanut butter is an abomination. I sprinkled a little sugar on top before baking. Not the best cookie I've ever had, but the easiest, quickest, and most readily available.
I remember making these cookies with my grandmother when i was about 12, i am 51 now and they are still amazingly easy and delicious!!
Loved it.
I enjoyed making this simple dish, however I preferred eating the dough more :) I will remember this recipe going forward.
Easy and simple to make, only recipe i use for peanut butter cookies. My family loves them and they never last.

This was absolutely delicious!! I would 100% make it again!! Itâ€™s super awesome to bring to someoneâ€™s house or have a party or something like that!! Just one helpful tip, when the batter is done, it looks super gooey and gross, but when you cook it (you donâ€™t need to cook for long), it turns out amazing!! I fed it to my entire family and they absolutely loved them!! Definitely making this again!!!
